New Records: Virat Kohli was 42 runs away from becoming the first batter to reach 4000 T20I runs
Alex Hales was 13 short of the 2000 mark in T20I runs
Key Match Events: England won the match by 10 wickets with 24 balls remaining
Sam Curran's emergence as Jos Buttler's go-to death bowler faced a stern test against India's high-strike-rate batting
Pre-Game Insights: England felt confident with their two must-win games and expected the toss to be academic
Jos Buttler mentioned the pitch preparation and confidence in groundsman's work
Key player matchups included Suryakumar Yadav vs Sam Curran and Ben Stokes
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch, despite being used earlier, was prepared well and consistent
The match was uninterrupted despite a morning shower forecast
Historical context of India's dominance over England in bilateral series and their previous World Cup meeting
Others: The toss might be academic due to minimal dew
Pitch conditions and weather played a role in the match preparation
